review_content: Nice, refreshing weiss bier. Light elderflower, banana and wheat. Tasted on the way to Samsø with my parents.
Delvis uklar gul med hvitt skum. Aroma og smak hvetemalt banan krydder humle frukt. Fruktig og frisk med moderat bitterhet. Smakt på Tromsø Ølfestival August -12

Bottle 330ml. @ Aalborg Lufthavn (AAL) (Aalborg Lufthavn), Ny Lufthavnsvej 100, 9400 Nørresundby, Danmark.

[ As Edelweiss Weissbier Snowfresh ].
ABV: 5.0%. Cloudy medium orange yellow colour with a small to average, frothy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, sweet malt, wheat, moderate yeasty, fruity yeast, dough, sweet yeast. Flavor is moderate sweet with a average duration, fruity yeast, sweet malt, wheat, sweet yeast, herbs, cardboard, banana - artificial fruit. Body is medium, texture is oily - creamy, carbonation is soft. [20180721]

 4-3-5-3-9
500ml bottle from Beers of Europe, King’s Lynn and drunk on 21/10/2009.  5.5% version.  Crisp and slightly drier than the usual hefeweizen and with more herbal notes than fruity ones.
Tap. Pale gold with light haze. White head. Aroma is wheat, banana, dried figs, pear. Very aromatic, almost soapy. Fresh and fruity and relatively dry for the type. Balanced carbonation.

Very nice banana, herbal, citrus aroma.
A little bit of bitterness in aftertaste.
Sweet and herbal taste.
Watery mouthfeel.
Hazy gold with a thin head, banana and orange nose with a herbal perfume, dry-sweet and lightly bitter, a little dry earthy bitterness.

Notas de plátano y pan blanco, aunque sin demasiada intensidad ni complejidad. De entre los sabores básicos predomina el dulce, bien equilibrada con un amargor ligero y algo astringente. Cuerpo medio. Buena textura y bebestibilidad.

這是一款白啤酒、小麥啤酒，顏色金黃帶混濁，特色是有一股藥草香氣，基本上沒有什麼苦味，大致上也符合白啤酒調性。
如果不喜歡苦味的啤酒，很推薦這一款，不過藥草所散發的味道，我認為第一次喝的人，是需要適應的。

Served in a frosted large handled mug, from Cock’s & Cows in Copenhagen. Not sure about the choice of glassware but...such is life.

From what I could tell the beer was a white-gold, hazy with two fingers of white head. Large and medium bubbles. 

As advertised, and in the commercial description the beer does have an aroma akin to what I would expect ‘alpine’ to smell like. Definite, overripe banana, wheat, bubblegum, coriander. Some floral notes and pine.

The taste follows, dominated by the coriander and the bubblegum. The alpine definitely comes through. A taste that is not unpleasant but not particularly good.

The mouthfeel is smooth, medium carbonation. Again, coriander and bubblegum dominate. Hints of wheat.  No alpine here. 

The best way to describe this beer is traditional in a different way. I would like to try served in the appropriate glassware and fresh. I feel the alpine element slightly detracts from the beer. It feels unnecessary.
Ikke det store sus, den har smag af hvedeøl, men der mangler mere dybte i den.
Odličan weizen! Iznenađuje okusom i mirisom... boja mutno zlatna, pjena bogata, ne toliko dugotrajna... ali odlično pivo... pogotovo po zimi

500ml can bought at 7-Eleven on Lock Road, Tsim Sha Tsui. 



Looks: Cloudy hazy straw golden honey colour with a cloud of misty yeast particles; Explosive four finger head with crumpety white foam which lasts for 5 minutes; Good sticky lacing with fizzy carbonation.



Aroma: Very fragment light malt, with strong vanilla, strong banana, apricots, yellow fruits, caramel, bubblegum, floral, sugar, strong cloves, spices, fluffy bread, strong yeast, lemon and grass. 



Taste: Mid to light sweet taste of light malt, with strong wheat, very light tartness, banana, strong fruity esters, perfume, phenolic, floral, fair sugar, spices, cloves, herbs, cakes, strong yeast, lemon, light bitter hops and grass.



Body: Close to medium body. Quite slick palate.



Mouth Feel: Light maltyness in a fairly solid background. Very estery and phenolic with expressive banana and cloves. Flowery with fair sweetness, herbal, cream cake with lemon to round. Very good! 



Hoppiness: Floral, spices, herbs, lemon and grass in nose and taste; Bitterness is low for an abrupt, light astringent sweet-bitter wheaty finish.



After Taste: Quite dry. Estery cakey and easy to mouth.



Comments: Another surprise from the can: excellent head and looks, expressive banana estery and perfumey aroma and taste, solid mouth feel with a subdued herbal lemon finish. It curves out its own niche as an excellent yet fun-filled weissbier. Will buy again!

Aroma: Sour berries. 
Flavour: Sour berries - likely unclean taps. 
Colour: Yellow with a white head. 
From: tap @ Restaurant Bones Tilst Aug. 2018.

Summer beer campaign at Family Mart: 330ml. bottle. Aroma: sweet, strawberries. Appearance: slightly opaque light amber, creamy lacing. Palate: thin-bodied and watery, soft carbonation, sweet at the finish. Taste: medium-sweet, floral notes, more strawberry. Intriguing and tasty, I could drink more.
Nice, refreshing weiss bier. Light elderflower, banana and wheat. Tasted on the way to Samsø with my parents.
Delvis uklar gul med hvitt skum. Aroma og smak hvetemalt banan krydder humle frukt. Fruktig og frisk med moderat bitterhet. Smakt på Tromsø Ølfestival August -12

Very nice banana, herbal, citrus aroma. A little bit of bitterness in aftertaste.…
Hazy gold with a thin head, banana and orange nose with a herbal perfume, dry-sweet and lightly bitter, a little dry earthy bitterness.

500ml can bought at 7-Eleven on Lock Road, Tsim Sha Tsui.…
Aroma: Sour berries. Flavour: Sour berries - likely unclean taps.…

Summer beer campaign at Family Mart: 330ml. bottle. Aroma: sweet, strawberries. Appearance: slightly opaque light amber, creamy lacing. Palate: thin-bodied and watery, soft carbonation, sweet at the finish. Taste: medium-sweet, floral notes, more…
Fles 50cl in Puybrun. Standaard. Wat zoetig. (8-2011).---------------------.
Tipicni weizen samo jos zeru bolji...odlicno ! Prekrasan miris,mutna boja i fini okus..jako pitko i preporuka svima def

Pivo u flaši. Ovo pivo se razlikuje od drugih Njemačkih pšeničnih piva po tome što ima dosta izražajniju banana aromu od drugih , a sreća je šta se ta banana isto tako osjeća i u okusu , tako da nije u nesrazmjeru sa aromom ...a da ne ispada da je to pivo od banane :) sve drugo je klasični Hefeweizen , znači osjeti se pšenićni slad, kvasac i malko limuna.
Kome god da sam ga preporučio , svakom se svidjelo :)..a tu je i "smiješna"  cijena od 10-11 kuna , što ga svrstava uz Hoegaarden i Leffe u kategoriju najisplativijih piva po kriteriju odnosa cijene i kvalitete !
0.33l bottle. Pours cloudy with creamy white head. Aroma is wheat and banana, with nice herbal and floral estery finish. Abit sweet. Nice weizen!
At the bird, tivoli, Strawyellow beer, small head. Aroma is wheat, herbal. Taste is the same, sweet, some bitter, ok
Odlično, nisam objektivan jer obožavam ovaj stil pive isto kao i hoegarden i blue moon
Boca 0,33L - korektan wajcen s aromom tog nekakvog bilja iako se gubi nakon prve boce :)

Hazy orange with big head; aroma is banana, herbal, perfume like, phenolic; taste is very sweet, banana, herbs, slightly citric, lingering sweet finish; texture is very thick and slightly sticky with medium carbonation

A: Cloudy light amber with a medium white head
N: None
T: Faint notes of grain, hops and perhaps some citrus. 
P: Thin
O: Very light

Pours semi hazy golden to orange color. Creamy white head. 

Aroma of banana and quite herbal. 

Taste is wheaty and slightly spicey. Hints of yeast. 

Smooth wheaty mouthfeel. Creamy to watery texture.

Nice taste, but a bit too orange taste. Consider it as a brother of Hogaarden. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Murky golden, small lasting creamy off-white head. Strong banana and citrus, lemon, malted wheat, candy. Sweet, light citric tartness. Medium body, soft carbonation, sweet estery finish. Not at all bad, aromatic, nice finish.
boca...kad se uliva blijedo žute boje sa prst debelom pomalo kremastom pjenom..okus iznenađujuće dobar sa tragom citrusa i bilja...HŽV

Bottle, 0.33l. Hazy yellow pour with slight reddish hue, two finger creamy white head. Very good head retention and nice looking lacing. Smell strikes as a bit weird at first, some relatively strong cardboard and hay off-notes. After a while it clears up a bit and then the nicer citrus and herbal part comes into play.

Thin to medium body, regular carbonation. Watery texture. Relatively sweet with mostly sour aftertaste. Aroma is herbal and floral, a touch of honey, a bit peppery, traces of caramel and cloves. Bubblegum. Grassy. Slightly dry finish with sweet and herbal mouthfeel.

Overall, good. Lacking in body a bit, but tasty nonetheless.

5%ABV. German Hefeweizen.

Tapped out gold 5ºSRM. Cloudy gold.

Nose has banana, bubble gum aromas. The nose on second approach has deep musty, slightly yeasty aroma notes.

Mouthfeel is beery. Palate has stone dust and dry wood. Raw wheat flour and raw proofing dough. Hops are bitter and prominent, so other than the brief peek of fruitiness at the beginning, it is otherwise pretty hop-forward. Some nice body to the palate with broad minerality on second approach.

Finish is sweet and lightly beery.

Enjoyed: Poured from a bottle into a weizen glass.
Appearance: Hazy pale orange colour, with small but densely head. 
Aroma: Wheat, banana, grass, spices.
Palate: Medium body, gentle carbonation.
Taste: Hint of sweetness (banana/pear), grass, spices. 
Overall impression: Tasty and drinkable; nice bottle.
Hazy yellow color, smalla white head. Aroma of citrus and banana. Taste banana, spices, herbs, honey. Lemon peel in aftertaste.
0.33l bottle. Hazy golden color with white head. Aroma of banana, citrus, clove, spices and bubblegum. Taste is sweet and little bitter.
Pours straw yellow with white head and medium carbonation. Aroma contains grain, banana, oranges and some herbal/floral notes. light body with some sweetness - overall a nice refreshing weizen
Guldgrumlig med vit skum. Doftar och smakar veteöl och lite estrigt. Ingen beska

Bue en pression au Coup d’Etat. Beau petit col de mousse à micro bulles. Arôme de fruits rouges très présent mais aussi floral. A se demander si le verre n’était pas mal rincé ! Bière très douce, presque sucrée/fruitée/florale. Un must ! Inattendue

Copenhagen 2/7 2016. 33 cl bottle from Meny, Bryggervangen, Kbh Ø. Very snowwhite label. 

Pours hazy golden yellow with white head. Settles as 0,5 cm thick layer of foam. Good lacing on the side of the glass. 

Aroma of banana, bubblegum, lemonade and something slightly fermented. 

Medium carbonation and watery texture. 

Taste is sweet lemonade with a light touch of citrus. 

A very pleasant and crisp summer drink. Should be named "Summerfresh" and not "Snowfresh".

Bottle 33cl / Botella 33cl.
@ Lika Mountain Liquor Store Inabaji, Nagoya, Japon.
A: Hazy golden / Dorado turbio.
T/S: Yeast, banana, sweet / Levadura, banana, dulce.

Hazy, yellow-orange colored, small not too lasting white head. Aroma is of wheat, cloves, bready and some banana. Taste is medium sweet wheat, banana bread and more cloves, yeast, some light herbal bitterness, light citric. Light to medium bodied, soft carbonation. Light and refreshing.
Bottle. 330ml 0,85 €. Viskas kaip turi būti: drumstas, graži puta...neblogas kvietinis alus

Cloudy golden color, head is medium. Aroma of herbs yeast and banana. Pleasant complex fruity taste and a touch of bitterness at the end. 10-15 years ago this was my favourite beer, lately I have tried better ones but this one is still pretty good!
Schöne 0,33l Relief-Flasche. Goldgelb und trüb. Wenig Schaum. Banane und Hefe in der Nase. Citrus im Antrunk, dann Banane. Für mich nicht rund.
Bottle. Aroma: citrus soda, herbs, orange and some aromatic chemistry. Taste: soda, barberry longer, sweetness, wheat, candy, obviously not mine.

Rich creamy foam. Wheat malts characteristic aroma of fresh grain blends in well with a little cilantro. The taste is something sweet for the type, and its fermented banana flavor is a little synthetic. At the finish line rescued it of little cilantro which despite injects a slightly sour taste in the final.

Cloudy yellow body with a large, white head. Good lacing. Sweet and strong aroma of artificially enhanced hefeweizen yeast, i.e. banana, bubble gum, candy and skumbananer. Also caramel. Strong flavour of yeast, artificial banana, candy, bubble gum, pale malts and hints of soap. Light sweet and light biter taste. Medium body, dry and lively carbonation. Not too bad, despite the highly artificial overall feel. 

[33 cl bottle, enjoyed 5 months after BB date(!), from Meny Frederikshavn, Jylland]

Pale golden color, cloudy liquid and medium head.
Citrus aroma.
Refreshing and light, great for the summer.
Very good witbier!
Bottle. Pours a golden body with a white head. Primary taste notes of banana, slight wheat notes on the side

Unclear amber color, short lasting little white head. Aroma: Mainly smell of banana, some notes of lemon and wheats. Taste: medium sweet with banana aftertaste. Light body, slickt texture, with soft carbonation.

Bottled. Head is slightly seen, no visible fizz. Looks cloudy, the color of amber. Taste is like banana and wheat, also lemon is felt. Palate is tickling on the roof of the mouth. Aftertaste is sweet, when very slight bitter and finally also sweet, too.
Cloudy golden, small white head. Yeasty aroma, light banana hints. Sweet banana flavour, light malt. Like a banana fruit beer.

Pours ajust a slightly hazy golden color, topped with a decent white head. Wheaty aroma, bananas with some yeasty aroma present., as well as slightly spicy. Taste similar. Wheaty, slightly sweet and fruity with some spice addition. Mild bitterness. Ok.
Pours a slightly hazy yellow gold color with white head. Banana, bread, and some light fruit on the nose; follows onto the palate. Finishes with some biscuity notes.

33cl bottle@home in straight glass@approx 7 degrees C. Pours hazy dark yellow with massive white head with very good retention. A little yeast in the subdued aroma does not give away the full taste of wheat, banana, lots of orange and unfortunately also som more artificial wine-gum like fruit. Wheat, malt and hops very restrained so a quite odd, but refreshing beer, not quite like the other Hefeweizens.
Very good beer. Really appreciated it. Just try it and you will see. A good one.
Golden colour with creamy white head. Aroma od wheat, yeasts, banana and little note of herbs. Similar are flavours. Notes of alpine herbs come to the light in finish but they are not so explicit.
Great wheat beer with herb aromas,not too yeasty.Very citrusy with herbal aromas .Great for drinking on hot today
Cloudy color, no foam, carbonated and lightly bitter. No distinct wheat aroma.

APPEARANCE: Coludy yellow/orange color, no foam, visible carbonation, small indicates sweet taste and wheat aroma.
AROMA: Not classic Hefeweizen aroma. 
TASTE: Light sweet, light bitter. 
PALATE: Present carbonation, but not too strong.

Color is hazy yellow with white head. Aroma of fruit and herbs, you could expect very sweet taste after you have smelled the beer, but it has a pleasant balance between the sweetness and bitterness. Althoug i think the finish is abrubt. Very refreshing.

Bottle 330ml @ yngwie

Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, wheat, unripe banana, herbal and yeast. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long banana, orange, wheat, herbal and yeasty finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft

Bottle. An unclear, orange-colored beer with a small, dense, off-white head. The aroma is citrusy and bananaish, with a pleasant herbal touch. Flowery notes and some peach. It’s a bit sweet on the palate, but at least there’s some bitterness. Herbal notes, banana and citrus in the flavor, doughy pale malts as a backdrop. It’s full-bodied and pleasantly carbonated. More carbonated than most beers, but far from too much. Lasting finish with some orange. Quite nice this one, I especially like the herbal touch. Easy drinkable. 150131

Refreshing, drinkable and tasty, this is a staple in my fridge if I want to enjoy a good and affordable weizen. Tiny head, with murky yellow colour. Well balanced notes of banana yeast, herbs, cloves. Bubblegum aftertaste. Like a said, really pleasant to drink, even though it’s not that exquisite to be the best hefe ever to grace this planet.

Bottle 330ml. Hazy yellowish with small off-white head. The aroma is spicy, fruity (banana, orange), yeasty with notes of bubblegum. Sweetish flavor, quite spicy and yeasty, clove, with citrus, notes of banana, some black pepper and bubblegum, spicy finish. Very carbonated, medium-bodied.

Refreshing, drinkable and tasty, this is a staple in my fridge if I want to enjoy a good and affordable weizen. Tiny head, with murky yellow colour. Well balanced notes of banana yeast, herbs, cloves. Bubblegum aftertaste. Like a said, really pleasant to drink, even though it’s not that exquisite to be the best hefe ever to grace this planet.
33 cl. bottle from Netto. hazy golden colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of herbs, fruit, spice, wheat and yeast.

Flasche mit Schraubkronkorken…. überflüssig sowas….Süßlicher Geruch. Der Antrunk ist frisch-fruchtig, insgesamt nur schwach hefig, dafür merkwürdig fruchtig-dominierend. Der Hauptteil ist vollmundig, fruchtig süßlich und leicht hefig. Im Nachgeschmack noch recht süß-fruchtig, mild, keine Herbe spürbar. 
 → interessantes Weizen, aber für meinen Geschmack etwas zu süß. 11/11/10/10

330ml bottle served in its own Weizen style glass.
A: Pours a cloudy yellow color forming a big and creamy white head. Good retention and some thin and lingering lacings in the glass
S: Very spice and herby in the nose. Strong notes of coriander, orange zest, sweet pale grains, wheat and flowery hops. Fruity and but at the same time, bready
T: Sweet upfront. Very spice taste as expected by the smell. Notes of oranges, pale malts and wheat. Very light bitterness. Quite close to a Witbier
M: Light body. Medium carbonation and a slightly sweet and spicy aftertaste
O: Excellent drinkability. Great Weissbier/Witbier ;)
[ BA Review @ 6/21/2014 ]

Bottle at home.
Clear amber coloured with a medium sized white head.
Sweet and fruity aroma of caramel, spices and bubble gum with notes of bananas.
Sweet and fruity flavour of bubble gum and cloves.
Sweet finish.

Süffiges leckeres Weissbier
---- personal review, no claim to be representative or neutral ---- repost undesired ---

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 0.33. Big white head. Hazy. In aroma banana, yeast. I have feel also that here are also some corriander and lemon notes, maybe from temperature of  fermentation or type of yeast. In flavor again bannana and corriander. Full body.
Update:  Corriander flavor and aroma are not from yeast, probably from added spices. There is also bubble gum in aftertaste.This beer is  hybrid of wit (corriander and lemon (orange)) and hefeweizen (wheat malt). Actually, pretty interesting.

Cloudy pale yellow color, minimal white head. Huuuuge bubblegum aroma, heavily sweet. Medium body, soft carbonation. Not bad, but I prefer banana over bubblegum.
(Kaufland Pula 0,5l bottle)

Old rating rerated 21.07.2014, 0,33l bottle @ holiday house in Ebeltoft:

Nice creamy mediumlasting head. Aroma is slightly sweet fruity, banana bubblegum, peach, yeast, hay, grass, sugar. Taste is slightly harsh yeasty, hay, yeast, banana, cereal, dough, citrus, spices. Little bitterness, slightly harsh and watery mouthfeel. Fair enough, nice ice cold in the sun.

Wow. I had no idea what to expect, but this is quite good. 33cl bottle, pours a nice frothy golden color, off-white head with significant lacing. Aroma is strong and fruity, with some banana and yeast notes. Flavor is fruit up front, raspberry, melon (yes, it’s weird to say) with a sweet malty back end. Not as spicy as a lot of weissbiers, but that’s fine by me. It’s more sweet and fruity. Very drinkable, goes down easy. Highly recommended.

Bottle @ Bornholm: Pours straw yellow with white head and medium carbonation. Aroma contains grain, banana, oranges and some herbal/floral notes. light body with some sweetness - overall a nice refreshing weizen
Bottle 0.33l from Pag Island Croatia.Pour it light yellow colour with small white head.Aroma and Taste of Banana, Citrus.Something between Wit and Weissbier.Great refreshment balance.Very good

Die große off-weiße Schaumkrone.
Hazy light golden body.
Flowerish almost perfumed scents, peaches, plums, oranges.
Sweet taste in spiced fruity malts, flowers, mandarines.
Fresh nice easy-going.
Sweet juicy finish, berries, oranges.
Close to being a juice more than a beer.
Maybe caused by that glocose fructose.



[33cl br btl abv5%, B@Spar Skrillinge, T@Middelfart Fyn DK]

I would definitely recognize the smell, and specially the taste, of this beer with my eyes closed tomorrow or years from now. Rich fruity palette, with stong fruity smell that Ibwould definitely wish could taste more often.
Bottle, pours a hazy yellow with a white head, tastes of fruit, malt, and some spices, smooth with a light bitterness, this seemed more like Witbier to me but it was still good.
słodki, kwiatowy,goździkowy zapach z nutą gumy balonowej. lekko zmętniony, złocisty kolor. w smaku słodko, lekkie nuty herbaty i kwaskowość.

Bottle from Au Grain D’Orge - Cloudy pale golden color with a small and fast disappearing white head - Aroma of wheat, herbal, citrusy, peach - flavor is herbal, fruity, and wheat - light body, fizzy carbonation, fruity herbal finish - good and refreshing but not really natural flavor
Nice and cloudy like it’s suppose to be. Crisp feel. Tastes of wheat, earth, citrus, yeast and spice at the end. I’d have it again

330ml bottle poured into a tumbler glass.
Hazy gold with a decent fluffy white head.
Sweet aroma of bananas and gum, with floral and herbal notes and fresh grain.
Banana is also a dominant flavor, with clean light malt, low bitterness and bubblegum.
Light body, a bit too sweet and lacks a yeasty character, but easy to drink and quite fun.

Poured into the Edelweiss glass, one finger of head on a hazy light straw colored body.
The aroma is faint lemon. Some more of something would have been nice.
The taste is wheat throughout with some mild lemon bitterness. Enjoyable.
The texture is smooth with moderate carbonation.
An enjoyable drink that tends towards a single wheat profile.

0.33 bottle. Colour is golden with average white head. Aroma is hops, wheat, citrus, herbal notes. Taste is ligtly sweet, spicy and lots of tropical fruits and citrus. Carbonation is low to average. All in all, pretty nice beer :)

Bottle 0.33l. Medium body, long lasting foam, average carbonation. Liquid clear to hazy, pale golden color. Aroma of creamy floral soap with soapy taste at start and after that very flowery. Interesting and different. Easy to drink.

Hazy/cloudy pale yellow color, thick, long lasting white head. Medium body, average to high carbonation. Aroma is wheat, banana, bubblegum, candy, hops, very light herbs touch. Weird candylike taste, gummy bears, bubblegum. Weird sugary Hefeweizen, but OK. Definitely memorable.

14-FEB-2014, bottle @Ulkløbben meeting, @Michael.
Milky yellow with White head.
Aroma is yeast, spice, hay’ish malt.
Taste the same with lemon elements as well.
Thin body, a Little creamyness, soft carbonation. Refreshing and a fine littel weisse.
Bottle 330 ml. Pours hazy yellow, fruity aroma. Wheat and fruity color. More Witbier than Hefeweizen,

Pours a murky golden, almost orange colour with a fizzy white head. Aroma: fresh and refreshing hops, wheat, straw, herbal notes. Taste: delicate floral notes over a mild (no bitterness here at all) hop base with hints of jasmine, honey, cloves, and citrus. Delicious and smooth, I will definitely drink more of this.

A very flowery and parfumated beer. Sweet. Perfect served Cold on a hot summers eve. Special beer overall, i havent tasted anything quite like it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a hazy golden color with a thin white head. Aromas are fruits, flowery hops and coriander. Slightly sweet finish.

Bottle. 
Hazy light Golden. Almost no head.
Yeasty Nose. Taste is a citrusy wheat. Decent atypical wheat beer.

Bottle from Liquor Mountain. Poured a bright hazy gold with snow-white head. Aromas of sweet fruit and grains. Creamy and smooth, with sweet banana, peach and cloves. Good value for money. A touch sweet perhaps, but a pretty decent wheat beer.

(33 cl bottle from supermarket; BBD: June 2014) Pours a hazy golden with rich, white head that dissipates fairly quickly leaving around 3 mm of head and lace. Aroma has some herbal or floral impressions as well as the typical wheat notes of banana and cloves. Oily texture, lively carbonation, medium body and a slightly acidic finish. Flavour is absent of bitterness and mostly defined by sweetness and flavour notes. Pleasntly refreshing when cold.
Shared bottle. A light weissbier. Pours clear yellow. Taste and aroma is typical weissbier with banana and some yeast.
Pours golden hazy with a light white head. Has aromas of citrus and hops. Has a mild taste of honey and a little hint of citrus.

Pours golden with little white head. Short lacing. Very notable flowerish, herbs of edelweiss, fresh, almost parfumish. Taste malt, flowery, coriander, citrus. Maybe too sweet. Lack of traditional bitter hobs taste. Refreshing beer priced at 1,5euros. Rebuy.
A nice solid white beer available for about 220yen from Liquor Mountain. Good price for a good beer. This was my go to weizen for quite awhile...

I love so much this wonderful beer! Especailly, the alpine herbs of Edelweiss makes me feel in the Alps mountains. The sweet finish is quite special. In short, Edelweiss snowfresh is always better than any other choice.
gulbrun lett tåkete med høyt hvitt skum. Lukter banan, urter, gjær og hvete. Middels- i fylde. Smaken er søt banan, gjær, sitrus, urter og noe honning. Noe tørr avslutning.

Head: white, big, creamy and very good retention. Colour: straw, hazy.

Aroma: strong aroma of wild flowers, perfume, coriander.

Taste: sweetish, flowery, coriander.

Intens aroma, maybe even luscious (artificial flavourings?) and the flavour is a bit too sweet too to my taste.
Frisk duft. Lite skum, tygg gyllen farge. Svak smak av citrus. Leskende og godt i sommervarmen.
rasberrys and herb aromas, pale and unclear beer, with a small head. slight bitter. too fizzy

Bottle. Pours into a hazy gold color with a thick white head. Very aromatic, smell is a nice mixture of tropical fruits and herbs. Taste is sweet, with some spicy, banana, cloves and herbal notes. Mouthfeel is light, thirst-quenching. Surprisingly good.
0,33l bottle. Aroma is banana, wheat and yeast. Taste is same as the aroma. Overall it is great beer, very tasty and drinkable, i recommend it.

Pours a cloudy golden yellow colour with a lasting thin but full white head with good lacing with every sip. Aromas of banana, clove, fruity, herbal(asumed to be alpine), wheat, and citrus. Flavour is wheat/bready, cloves, fruity, herbs, light vanilla, sweet banana, a bit of a citrusy tartness.
Thanks J.E.W. Pours hazy yellow with a white head. Lots of banana and wheat. Sweet with a touch of bread , lime and yeast. Medium bodied.

Bottle. Average white fizzy head. Mostly diminishing. Fair lacework. Aroma of banana, wheat, fruit, citrus, yeast. Medium bodied, average carbonation. Medium sweet flaver. Lingering wheat and banana finish.
Bottle. Hazy yellow with a medium white head.Aroma is wheat, citrus, fruit. Flavor follows the nose. Quite nice actually.
Bottle. Pours hazy light yellow with a disappearing white head. Aroma is banana, wheat, and bubblegum. Flavor is those notes plus some cloves. Pretty decent, though the finish is oddly short.
Unstrained wheat beer with herbs and the edelweiss flwers. Very sweet and delicious. Has a nice banana aftertaste

banana, bubblegum, grass, bread, golden, hazy, minimal head, white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, umami, light body, creamy, slick feel, average carbonation, bitter finish. 
Hazy golden pour with slight white foam.  Lacing apparent. Big banana aroma with slight sweet bubble gum and bread. Taste is firstly sour with a ripe banana sweetness then a light bitter sweetness takes over. Light carbonation creates a creamy slickness in the mouthfeel from an otherwise thin body. Finish is slightly dry with some astringency.  Mild bitterness in aftertaste is short lived. Nice hefe.

(Bottle 33cl) Pours dazy yellow with a tall white head. Fruity wheat nose. Good hefe wheat flavours of wheat wheat yeast and some fruit. Rather sweet and some artificial bubblegum, which becomes disturbing in the end
Tastes like an assembled marriage of German hefeweizen and Belgian witbier. Dry and tart with a pronounced yeast flavor.

330ml bottle. Small glazed white foam. Quite easy carbonation, small bubbles. Aroma has apples, yeast and sour pineapple which disguises the wheat. Flavour is more wheat, some apple fruit, there is soap here and some citric sense by the sides of the tongue.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

33 cl bottle poured in to a weizen. Hazy, darker golden colour with a big, fluffy, white head. Sweet aroma with bubblegum, banana, a herbal note, citrus and wheat. Taste is sweet. Medium body, slick texture, fine carbonation with lots of small bubbles. Finishes sweet with a herbal note, candy, light yeasts and coriander. Not for me, too sweet for a hefeweizen.
Looks like a pretty standard hefe. Aroma is pretty light, some banana and some spices not bad but not powerful. Taste is some sour Granny Smiths, banana, light clove. Not too bad.

.5l bottle from Kuca Piva in Zagreb. Sweet carbonated weiss, on the sweet bubblegum spectrum. but very refined and overall a tasty beer with licorice, slight souring notes. Hazy hot body. A nice, sweet and well put together glass with flavor all around. Great sweet bite on top of the other banana-lace notes for this beer. A great one.
Bottle at Cafe Biografen. Cloudy golden with a big white head. Aroma dominated by banana, with some sweet malt and yeasty notes. Overly sweet, yeasty and banana-filled flavour.

Bottle. Strong, herbal aroma. Pleasant, hazy golden look, with white, a little unstable head. Strongly aromatic, herbal taste with a taint of yeast and herbs. Highly carbonated. Not bad, definitely not bad.
Not a fan of the nose - reminded me of detergent.  Overall this is a clean crisp beer that in not very engaging.

Bottle. Pours haze pale yellow with large non-lasting chalky head. Aroma is rose fragrance soap, banana bubblegum, ginger and hints of wet paint. Taste is light sweet and light acidic. Body is watery with soft carbonation. Finish is short with notes of ripe fruit and dried fruit. Faint chalky after-taste. Not really a good weißbeir, but it has a nice and different, very synthetic - yet not unpleasant - aroma.

Oh alright, just one more beer for lunch. Why not.
Cloudy straw colour under a rocky white head with definite carbonation. Good weissbier aromas of basement, spice, clove and over-ripe lemon zest.  The flavour is... well, there. It is fulsome with tingling carbonation and a flush of lemon juice, golden pastry and sweet tangy citrus. A hint of bitterness but not challenging. It leaves a finish like lemon sherbet and leaves me leaving my lunchtime with a lovely floating feeling that should nicely ruin any productivity this afternoon.
Bottle. One finger foam. Haze Golden. Coriander citrus aromas. Dry crisp medium body. Quite long finish. Very nice tasty brew.
Bottle at Politikern. Yellow body, nice white head. Aroma of banana, spice and wheat. Taste of wheat, spice and lemons, a bit too sweet for style I think. Good carbonation, sweet wheat finish.

Beer-marathon, Sdr. Borup / Randers the 2012th Haze yellow beer with a white head. The aroma is sweet for malt, yeast, coriander with notes of citrus. Sweet flavor, malt korianter with notes of citrus
Orange coloured beer with a medium white head. Aroma is sweet, wheat and faint fruit. Sweet taste, wheat, yeast, faint citrus, soft. Creamy texture. Medium palate.
Bottle @ bakken dk. Toast, resin, grass, citrus, earthy, banana, bubblegum and even more fruits in the taste.

0,33 l brown twist top bottle enjoyed at one of the promenade patios in Split. ABV is 5,0 %. Cloudy golden body with a large fluffy big bubbled white head. Inviting nose rich with fresh herbs, flowers, ripe fruit especially peaches. Sweet, spicy and lots of tropical fruits and citrus that lasts into the finish. Light to medium body.  Well carbonated aiding the fresh overall impression. A welcome relief and most recommended.
Bottle..... It pours hazy orange/yellow with a medium white head..... The aroma is nice with coriander and citrus.... The flavor is fresh of orange, citrus and Spice coriander......
No head, cloudy. Nice nose with candised orange peel, sugar, perfume. Medium body and length. Soft with a fine orange, coriander and a little mandarin liquor.

On bottle at Beck’s.
Good intensity fruity aromas 
Medium body & complexity.
Citrus aromas, refreshing and  well balanced
enjoyable
From old backlog. Flavour is banana and wheat. Have to try this one again. Really refreshing.

Very nice beer. Its very smooth and refreshing. It has pale orange gold color with good carbonation. It has refreshing herbs but not overpowering. Mild weizen banana and clove. It’s light, thin and smooth. Beautiful beer that I must try once again when I will have a chance to buy it.

Strong sweet aromas of wheat, cloves and citrus. Pours the typical hazy yellow with a frothy white head. Flavors were a little weak but consisted of banana, bubblegum, wheat and slightly tart citrus. Creamy mouthfeel with a sweet finish. A surprisingly excellent Hefe.
Odd aftertaste on this one. Maybe there was something wrong with the bottle, because i’ve never tasted a beer that I just could’nt drink up. hmm.

Bottle from the local Liquor Mountain discount shop. Spices big in the nose, honey, banana. Cloudy dull yellow. Light artificial chemical banana flavors, which rise to the nose like a bad cologne... Very thin. The aroma is a lot better than the flavors. As if they didn’t have enough malt or unmalted wheat to balance the spice. A bit repugnant, really. Like a soft drink for children. Uh-uh... Well, it’s not exactly drain pour, but almost.

Slightly hazy pale yellow. Quite a sedate head. Aromas of yeast, apple. Taste has funky yeastiness, sharp, sour apple and spice. Unusual flavours. Something coniferous. Tiny bit of banana? Odd. All adds up to something reasonably compelling though.

earthy, citrus, herbs, caramel, nuts, alcohol, rotten eggs, vanilla, banana, amber, sparkling, tan foam, white foam, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, heavily sour, full body, creamy, average carbonation, bitter, long finish,

0.33l bottle @ Kalfaret Brygghus. A light blurry golden-yellow Weiss with a big almost massive - dense and lasting white head. The aroma is light hefe-yeasty with lots of wheat and some hints of both cloves and flowers. Oh, this tastes bubblegum Deluxe. Really wheaty with both cloves and yeast, but that sweet bubblegum really explodes in the mouth. A nice one and quite different. 16.02.2012

Bottle at Dickens in Sarpsborg, Norway 03 march 2012. Light hazy yellow colour with a small white head. A unusual mild flavour with somw wheat and light citric. Also a mild flavour with some banana and wheat. Would have expected a bit more from an Austrian hefe weisse.

Bottle @ Kalfaret Brygghus. Slightly hazy straw yellow body with a creamy medium white head. Aroma is mineral salts, banana, Norwegian Christmas soda ("julebrus" - artificial cherry/red berry-like stuff) and hints of citrus fruits. Taste is citrus, banana, clove and hints of hay. Filling mouthfeel. A bit sweet for my tastes, but a pretty decent, average weizen; slightly overrated IMO.

Draught at Little Prague, Tel Aviv. Pours clear golden with dense white head. Aroma: dried banana, bubblegum. Taste: sweet, some bitterness with a hint of sour, but sweetness is dominant here. Thin body, slick texture, lively carbonation, long finish - balanced and fun.

33 cl bottle @ Hullu Poro

Stale and sweet aroma with wheat, citrus and some banana. Flavour is somewhat tart and sweetish with citrus, some wheat and hints of banana. Straightforward, but refreshing and nice.

Bottle at restaurant. Pours hazy dull strawcolour with a frothy, and a little bit creamy,  white head. Pretty aromatic with grains and fruity yeast of banana. Also some spices in the nose. Much of the same in the flavour but more fruity and a slightly taste of esters with pear.Light bitterness. A silky and creamy mouthfeel. Fresh and deliciously tasty. Tried it with sushi and this really awekened the spices and the sweetnes worked well against each other.
Bottle at Skarsnuten. Aroma of wheat, yeast and spices. Some sweet banana with slightly bitter and sour finish.
Bottle. Yellow slightly foggy colour, head qvickly disappearing, but with an aroma quite great for a weissbeer. Taste is medium, but the aftertaste a bit too sour.

0.33 bottle. Extremely firm fruity aroma, mostly banana and bubblegum. Pale golden liquid, slightly hazy, small head disappearing almost instantly. Decisive sweet taste with small sour tones making it refreshing and drinkable rather than heavy and sticking up. Rather light body and thin texture, lively carbonation and medium sweet-sour finish. Surprisingly good, distinguishable from its own style through its concreteness and determined taste, might be to sweet for some yet worth trying, uncommon.
Bottle: Hazy yellow color with a white head. Aroma is light wheat and citrus. Taste is rather citrus fruit with a nice wheat hint, more of a witte than a hefe to my palate.

Smelling this beer is like walking in a fruit garden, where you find bananas, peaches, lemon, oranges, apples, you name it. Tastes mostly of peaches and bananas but you have the herbs there as well. A very, very nice beer. A mix of Beligian ale and a weissbier. First class!

Bottle @ The Oak Barrel, Helsinki. Pours hazy golden with a small white head leaving lace. Aroma is yeasty, bananas, wheaty, fruity, cloves and spicy. Flavor is very fresh, nicely wheaty, yeasty and spicy with some cloves, cumin and perry. Finishes yeasty, fruity and slightly bitter.

citrus, resin, herbs, pale, hazy, white foam, frothy, light sweetness, banana, light body, thin feel, soft carbonation.
Citrusy-herbal smell, stable head with good lacing, clearer than most wheat beers I’ve seen but still hazy. 
Strong Banana taste at first swallow, recedes into an almost lemony taste after a few seconds. Not very much aftertaste other than a slight lemony feel. Not bitter at all. 
+3 on the nice bottle. -10 on a screw-top. (shame of you, Snowfresh!) Decent beer. Not the best Wisse I’ve tasted, but fun.

Bottle @ Lanterna Camping, Croatia. Pours hazy light golden with a big white head. Aroma of wheat, coriands, sweet fruit, perfume. Taste is wheat, sweet fruit, banana, bubblegum. Thin body, soft carbonation. 220711
330mL bottle.  Pours hazy yellow with big offwhite head, notes of banana, grain and wheat, great carbonation, almost medium body just a tad bit on the thin side, but overall quite a nice weiss.

33cl bottle in CDG airport. Slightly hazty pale yellow color, foamy white head leaving mild lacing. Soft, and a little too strong of carbonation. lemony smell, citrusy grapefruit aroma. Somewhat spicy taste. Became much more enjoyable once I took the first bite of my mediocre, overpriced airport wrap.

Pours cloudy amber with a large head.
Massive banana on the nose alongside bubblegum and doughy wheat. Smells like banana confectionery.
Nice banana and wheat flavours up front before a grainy note enters. Short finish.
Body feels watery.
Some sweet herbal note is noticeable in both the aroma and as a flavour, I can’t quite pick it...

Bottle 0.33 L in Lyon.
Pale yellow, hazy body with a large, creamy, white head, mostly lasting with a nice lacing.
Moderate malty and hoppy aroma (bread, lemon) with some light yeasty character (dough); herbal and floral notes due to the added herbs are also present.
The flavour is mainly sweet with evident bitter and acidic notes.
Medium body with an oily texture; lively carbonation and just a light astringency in the finish.

Bottle. Pours a hazy, pale yellow with a white head. Fresh floral and yeasty aroma with a distinct sweet perfume candy note and a dusty overtone. Flavour is sweet perfume again, with a tart citrus (bit of lemon, bit of orange) note mucking about, as well as some notes of yeast and dust. A bit unbalanced and somewhat cloying. As it warms, the sweet perfume note turns into bubblegum. Finish is more sweet perfume; later bubblegum, with a touch of citrus. Lingering watery and yeasty notes. This beer has its moments, but overall too sweet, perfumy and cloying for my liking.  29.03.11.

Bottle. Cloudy orange with a large but fading white head. Aroma is sweet with bubblegum, orange peel, coriander and herbs. Quite bready texture. Taste is sweet with some citrus and a spicy finish. There’s a little wheaty/ citrus tang but it’s rather buried under too sweetness for me.

Very sweet bubble gum candy aroma.
Murky amber colour with good head and lacing.
Sweet candy bar fruit flavour.
Smooth palate.

very cloudy, yeast haze.  strong aromas of yeast and barley.  tastes of sweet fruit with some citrus.  smooth with minimal aftertaste.  decent wheat beer, but just a little below the calibre of many of the more popular Belgian wheats.
Cloudy golden almost without head. Aroma is wheaty, bubblegum, banana, yeasty and spicy - cloves. Flavor is rather sweet. Soft and smooth with a dry and spicy finish. 160610

330ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a very cloudy white-ish yellow and the head sticks around for quite a while. Aroma is citrus and very yeasty, but pleasant. Palate is slightly watery, and very citrusy. Certainly a subtle herbal quality there as well which I could take or leave. Okay.
light abrikos aroma,pale, hazy, white foam, medium sweetness, salty, medium body, creamy, soft carbonation, long finish,
Light orange and unclear. Has a white head, medium duration. Sweet aroma, sugars and faint fruit. Sweet flavor, apricot, yeast, faint citrus, soft. Creamy texture.

Pale yellow with a large head. Very aromatic with notes of herbs. tastes like candy for my taste buds with its delicious taste of bubblegum. exciting and very special witbier but incredibly delicious and refreshing..

Bottle 330ml. Very good, it feels really fresh. Aromas of bubblegum, banana, coriander, and apple. Taste is sweet, with just a hint of sourness, and average duration. Palate is oily, with a medium body. Yellow, cloudy, with a frothy head.
Pours light hazy yellow. Aroma of bready yeast, mango, banana and some earth. Taste of banana, mango, a bit spice, yeast and some white bread.
Hazy yellow with a white head. An aroma of wheat, spice, herbs and sweets. A flavor of spice, banana, wheat, sweets and fresh.

Appearance: Pale orange, quite hazy. Nice amount of white head.
Aroma: Wheat, nice lemon. Slight yeast and sweetness. Banana.
Taste: Wheat and citrus. Banana, sweetness. Nice.
Info: 330ml bottle, 22/1-2011

pours pale yellow with a slight haze, decent white head. wheat, banana, clove and a little spicyness. sweet wheat - too sweet for my taste (added sugar as stated on the label). don’t really taste the herbs but there’s an herbal feeling that does not seem to be coming from the hops... interesting for the weiss lovers, but nothing spectacular here, at all.

Slightly hazy pale yellow.  Quite a sedate head.  Aromas of yeast, apple.  Taste has funky yeastiness, sharp, sour apple and spice.  Unusual flavours.  Something coniferous.  Tiny bit of banana?  Odd.  All adds up to something reasonably compelling though.

It pours a yellow cloudy color with a pure white fine head. It has a average amount of carb. Oh as well there is some yeast sediment in the bottom.

On the nose I am getting a dose of wheat but mostly a sweet bubblegum presence. Nothing amazing here.

The flavor is similar to the aroma. Some solid wheat,bubblegum,candy. There is some banana notes but nothing that stands out. Overall it is pretty sweet for my palate.

It finishes with citrus and a touch of hops. As far as the style goes there are so many better options out there. This is worth a shot but not something I would reach for again.

Rating #313, bottle from Hatten Bar at Grønjordskollegiet, earlier this rating was stored rating under "Edelweiss Hefetrüb Weissbier" by a mistake 
 


A spiced up hefeweizen with a good bunch of citrus and undefinable spices (alpe flowers?) in both nose and flavor, but on the other hand lacks banana and hay. Medium palate, quite ok, but deserves a re-rate as I was pretty drunk when I made these notes... Update coming as soon as possible; my local salesman has some of these for me again

330ml bottle. Reasonably pale with a lot of haze that eventually clears. Crisp clean white head that starts off fairly big but quickly drops the level of foam to almost nothing. Sweet banana aroma that is ripe with some clove spiciness. Light and airy in the mouth with a bit of a flat aftertaste mixed in with some sweetness.

cloudy yellow, smooth white head.
Yeast, fruits, wheat in the aroma. fruity and mild.
flavor of wheat,faint peach, faint herbal spicy note (sweet mild herbs).
Overall an interesting beer that does taste a little bit of "alpine herbs". Compared to an ordinary wheat, it seems to be a little mit more mild and soft, and it seems to have a slight herbal "fresh green herbs" touch.
However, in the end, the herbs almost is a bit "too much".

330 ml bottle @ Mallashovi.

Pours a clear yellow colour, small white head. Aroma of wheat and light citrus. Flavour of wheat, mild honey, herbs, citrus and some grass. Light bodied, slick mouthfeel. Drinkable.

Bottle. Pale yellow pour, frothy white head. Aroma is very fresh smelling, forest floor, mint, pine and generally the whole great outdoors (I kid). Taste has a good sweetness to go with the variety of herbal notes. Palate is standard, light bodied, moderately carbonated. I wasn’t sure if I was having desert or a beer, but it was enjoyable.

Bottle at DØE, medlemsmøde.
Hazy light yellow with a lazing beige head. Aroma moderate wheaty, citrusy and spicy. Flavor moderate sweet and acidic. Medium body.

Bottled@O’Malleys, Vaasa. Yellowish golden with a mediumsized creamy head. Aroma is herbs, grass, some mild bready malts as well as some slight saltwatery notes. Flavour is bready malts, some mild sweetish malts as well as some herbs, grass and mild notes of grains.

The perfect wheat beer pour. Pale yellow, pristine white foam, micro fine head & gentle - yet persistent fine carbonation. Subtle Kool mint & candy banana nose, refreshingly different. Textbook wheat beer texture. Orange peel & coriander before the Kool mints & candy banana perform their encore make their return, only to be drowned out by classic bacon fat wheat beer characteristics. Absolutely delicious stuff. If peculiar. Take that, Hoegaarden!

(Bottled@HBF 2010, sampled 2010-04-09) Very murky orange with a small, lasting head. Flowery nose with lemon and witbier spices. Sweetish flavor of strawberry and fruit, with light acidic lemon twist. Almost medium body, slightly fizzy CO2. A very witbier-like weizen - not bad, but not interesting.

Bottle.

Hazy golden with a large white head. Citrus, light banana, spices, perfume and candy. Quite strange taste indeed. Drinkable.

Bottle. Medium gold, somewhat cloudy, high effervescence. Offbeat aroma is difficult to place, with an odd mixture of lemon and earth. Despite the intriguing aroma, the flavour is bland, with mild floral and clove added to a general blah. Nice idea, but missing something.

Misty yellow pour fluffy white head medium carbonation aroma grain fruit yeast a perfume touch really spice flavour banana clove edelweiss lemon orange not much bitter no harm good malt sweet aftertaste though mildly sour
Pours hazy light yellow with a high head. Aroma is banana, wheat and herbs. Flavor is a bit lighter than expected with wheat and some herbs. Very refreshing and quite nice.
Light yellow colored with cloudy head. Wheaty and floral aroma with banana too, sweet one. Medium bodied. Flavor is also wheaty with thin yeast and lemony banana, aftertaste id mildly hopped.

Pours pale yellow with a large, soapy head. Very aromatic. Notes of herbs off the top that continues with banana and bubblegum across the palate. Lightly carbonated with a very light body...could easily quaff the whole glass in one go. Most refreshing. Definitely recommended...

Originally rated November 2008. Best before 02-2009. This herb wheat beer poured a cloudy golden-beige colour with a big white frothy head, good retention, some little separate lace spots and active carbonation. Very nice smooth aromas of bananas, wheat and yes, oat soap. The one that comes in the push bottle, that makes your hands smelling so nice. I must say that I was quite surprised when I saw the twist-off cap on this one. The palate is quite smooth, and kind of watery, making this one quite refreshing. I can detect a little bubblegum in the aftertaste, but have a hard time finding the spices in the rest of the taste. Orange, wheat, but very well-blended. Overall, a nice weizen that is really refreshing (but was expecting more from the spices).

Tasting at DØE meeting, Aarhus Syd. DK.
Bottled, 160610.
Golden with white head. Aroma of coriander seed and wheat. Flavor is bubblegum, wheat, orange and spices

Bottle. Hazy, pale golden orange pour with a foamy white head that doesn’t last long. Aroma has notes of banana, lemony citrus, clove, coriander and mint. Flavour is pretty much the same although it really does tatse icy and fresh. Light watery mouthfeel with moderate carbonation and a lingering spicy, bitter finish. Quite good overall, would be great warm weather beer.

Le liquide a une couleur jaune pâle embrouillée.  Petit nuage de mousse blanche.  Le nez est attaqué par des effluves de blé, de banane, d’épices et de bonbons.  Au goût, le liquide donne principalement du blé, de la levure, des bananes et des aromates insaisissables.  La finale est douce et pleine de fraîcheur.  En résumé, agréable et assez unique.
Bottled 0.33L. Pale large head. Pale golden slightly hazy colour. Some hints of banana and flowers in the nose. Soft lemoney and wheaty taste. Mildly hopped taste of herbs and spices.

Finally becoming more readily available at the LCBO locations.  Golden orange hazy appearance, smells like spice, orange, banana, zest.  taste is predominant spice & citrus.  Ice cold on a hot day = winner

(Bottle) Poured pale yellow and cloudy. Head was white and medium sized. Aroma contained fruitiness, banana and herbs. Palate was light bodied with quite high carbonation. Flavours were fruitiness, pineapple, banana, sweetness and mild bitterness. Aftertaste didn’t last long and was sweet and fruity. Like drinking pineapple soda.

Bottle, from Rideau’s LCBO. Extremely pale, hazy, fizzy looking. Small and light white head. Not that persistent, except for the lace. Some hints of resin, bread, leaves, flowers, plus some spices I can’t really identify. Absolutely NO bitterness. Light-bodied. Rather thin texture (for an hefe). Surpisingly complex for such a refreshing beer. Fruity (orange) and spicy (cardamon, coriander), but not in an overwhelming fashion. Will be a must for my girlfriend... And for me, as well.

This one does its name justice. It is extremely fresh. Nose gives hints of a fruit beer, as there is distinct citrus & watermelon about. Taste is a garden. Flowers of all varieties mesh with delicious wheat and spring water for freshness the likes of not many. Don’t really know if I’d call it "snowfresh", as I don’t exactly know what that is.
Bottle@ HBF 2010. Pours hazy, almost yellow color with a nice white head. Aroma is spices, coriander, and citrus. Flavour is fruity, more to witbier style than weissbier. OK.
Bottle. Nice head with medium duration. Color is pale and hazy golden. Aroma and taste are wheat malt, yeast, hops and herbs.

Bottle. Hazy yellow with a medium white head. The aroma is very spicy coriander and citrus. The citrus continues in the flavour with lots of spices. Orange, herbs and coriander. Refreshing and quite unique weissbier.

330 ml bottle from LCBO.  Pours a hazy pale yellow with moderate white head.  Aroma of banana, citrus and spices.  Taste is banana, spice and citrus but with more sweetness and some different spiciness than a typical weissbier.  Interesting and fairly enjoyable.

Slightly hazy golden coloured body with a very thick white head that fades fairly fast and leaves a nice thin lace on the side of the glass. Aroma of pale malt, yeast, lemon, coriander seed and a touch of curacao. Medium-bodied; Spicey allspice, anise, nutmeg, cardamom and even cloves tucked in this - a strong spice character when the smell and appearance don’t predict the taste. Aftertaste shows the spice throughout with a good wheat/malt backbone, some yeast and a tiny bit of curacao and lemon sweetness. Overall, a good beer that probably would show well on a mountain after a day of skiing or even on a nice summer day. I definitely liked this and would recommend it to others to try! I sampled this 33 cL bottle purchased from the LCBO in Toronto (Summerhill), Ontario, Canada on 11-October-2009, sampled at home in Washington on 21-January-2010.

330ml bottle

Pours a light golden color with about a one inch foam head. 
A very light tasting beer. Almost tastes like ginger ale. It goes down very easy. I could defenetly have several of these in a row

Smells floral and purfumee, almost rose like, a bit odd for a beer. Hazy and light yellow with red hues, fairly clear. nice lacing. Easy tasting, very smooth, only lightly malty, as I drink more it becomes much more floral and almost like baby powder in the nose. Like a beer for the wood elf ladys or something. quite nice and bubbly on the toune, smooth aftertaste. Quite a nice easy beer, a bit more floral than I would usually like, this one is wearing just one or two puffs too many of that nice purfume.
In bottle; aroma of trees (Felt like Christmas) and spice. Taste, subtle herb and spice notes. Overall is was OK, I just struggled getting past the aroma

Bottle. Pouring this beer you notice that it looks a bit thick and almost orange, not too clear. Average aroma but its almost like a perfume and it has a distinct herb taste that is a little overpowering. Overall it is an average beer but worth a try.
Bottle. Hazy Orange/golden colour with medium creamy white mostly diminishing head. Fresh fruity aroma. Sweet fruity flavor. Dry finish.

Bottle. 5%. Aroma is floral/herbal hops and yeast, with a bit of banana and citrus. Taste is very herbal, coriander and cloves, I feel like I’m drinking a Weissbier and sniffing a mountain scented air freshener at the same time. Sounds strange, but aptly describes this beautiful looking but bizarre tasting beer. Hazy yellow pour with a decent white head, mild retention.

Bottle (in NZ). Pours a hazed pale yellow. Mostly banana on the nose, with a hint of lemon. Quite a bit of sourness to the palate, with a stoned-fruit flavour. Not what I was expecting at all, and different enough for me to rate it a bit higher.

On tap @ The Warf.Pours cloudy yellow with a nice white head.Aroma of coriander,banana and citrus.So far so good.Flavor is bubblegum with some sourness and fruitiness , not very appealing.Cidery ,fizzy and thin.Didn’t work for me.

330 mL Bottle. pale cloudy straw body with a frothy white head. Aroma very floral with notes of pine and spruce, a hint of cloves, and a subtlest soupçon of camphor. Wheat and banana dominate in the taste, apricot and cloves come through in the aftertaste, cantaloupe and allspice in the creamy finish.
Gutes Bier!

330ml bottle. Chilled down too far at Tromsø Ølfestival 09. Cloudy, orange body with a decent white head. Semi-sweet aroma of spiced fruits. Predominant flavour of banana split with notes of wheaty malts and citric hints, but still too sweet. Medium bodied. Some freshness to it &#40shared with Finn and Marcus, 20.08.2009&#41.

thick hazy off-yellow. quickly disapating white head. nose; clove, candied orange, herbal, sweet wheat. mild flavours, not much happening here, standars wheat beer, gets a little better as it warms, not enough though.
Bottle 33 cl. Hazy yellow with a white head. Perfumy coriander nose, yeast and phenols. Medium body, fruit, yeast and spices with a dry finish. Quite fresh. 270509
smells like a weisse, a bit weak and lagery. colour is gold, it tastes lagery, a little weissy, kind of apple/peary, dark feeling. not too bad.

Flaske 0,33l på Tromsø Ølfestival 20 Aug 09. Vanvittig pris: Kr. 95,-. Flere andre middelmådigheter på småflasker til samme vanvittige pris. Good grief! Lys gylden på farge. Et pent hvitt skum. Rik aroma av citrus og litt gjær. Sterk fruktig smak av banan og eple - men blir etterhvert veldig søt. Kunstig preg. Uklart.
Bottle. Hazy golden with frothy white head. Fruity, yeasty aroma. Nice spicy notes, with good wheat and yeast flavours.
On tap at the Wharf, Aalborg. golden- yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is sweet, coriander, bananan, orange. flavour is sweet, perfumed, citrus, orange. Strange beer.

Bottle from the LCBO. Lots of herbs and spices in the aroma as well as some sweet fruits. Taste is similar and yeasty with a nicely carbonated feel. Wicked taste and definitely a unique treat every once in a while.
33cl bottle. Cloudy golden body with medium size white head. Flavour is wheat, yeast, citrus and spices.
Bottled sample via MLCC. Again I was surprised at how flavourfull this was. Nicely caronated and wonderfully spicy.  Would buy this again in a heartbeat.

Cloudy light gold with thick white head thins quickly. Fruity yeast aroma. Very tasty, easy drinking, floral, fruit & spice blends well with a long lasting orange banana aftertaste. Surprised the scores are so low.
I buy this beer in one shop in Croatia but i forgot where .. i love the look of bottle .. the beer is little spice and sweet .. it is not so good but drinkable ...

It is unclear golden with a white head. The aroma has notes of flower, wheat, spice, yeast and perfumed soap. The flavour has sweetness and notes of spice, perfumed flower and candy/soap, wheat and the finish has a decent bite of spice/yeast. I had hoped the flavour was as good as in Edelweiss Dunkel, but I was disappointed.
Bottle. Very citrusy nose, with spice and cloves notes. Quite lively and light on the palate, with banana and wheat predominating, and well carbonated, but not overly so. A decent weissbier.

330 ml bottle at Øl&Mat09 in Oslo. Hazy golden color, nice white head. Aroma is fruity with banana, wheaty and a bit spicy. Flavor is almost soapy, perfumed and floral, and has some sweetness. Refreshing, but a bit syntetic.
Bottle, 5.0%. Quite clovey and citric flavour. Also quite sweet. Cloudy pale yellow colour. White head. Teaish aftertaste. Promising at first, but the flavour fades away in the finish.

Pours a hazy golden white.  Aroma is a typical weissbier aroma - sweet, spicy and floral, with a bit of bubblegum.  Flavour is subtle and refreshing, with the sweetness and bubblegum coming through again.  Palate is clean with a good amount of carbonation.  Overall quite nice.

Bottle. Pours hazy light yellow, generous amount of white frothy lacing and a big white head. Aroma is lemony, spicy, with a lot of fruity aromas. A bit on the perfumy side. Flavour is artificial berries, banana, spices and a bit too sweet and perfumy for my tastes. It’s sort of all wrong yet tasty at the same time. Mouthfeel is good, round and creamy.

Pours a cloudy lemon-yellow, with a great thick white head that gradually reduces to a ring, with nice lacing. Nose is lemon, wheat malt, spun sugar, banana. The lemon smells candied, but in a very good way. Palate is lemon candy, bubblegum, cotton candy, and spice. Does not have the mouth-coating feel of most weisse beers, finishes crisp and clean instead. I have always had a soft spot for this beer. Glad to see it stands up now that I’ve finally rated it.
Pours hazy yellow, almost no head. Aroma is light , citrus, yeast and spicy. Flavour of wheat malt, spices, orange peel and bananas. Smooth and fresh as snow.

Bottle. Hazy yellow colour with a medium white head. Citrus and wheat in the aroma. The flavour is citric wheat with some spices, yeast and herbs. Quite thin-bodied and highly carbonated. Good, refreshing beer.

With the fancy bottle and advertised addition of Alpine herbs, honestly, I didn’t give this much of a chance, but I was totally wrong. The beer is obviously not a Krystal Weisen due to the thick, cloudy gold appearance. Poured out a nice white foamy cap but it sizzled down to a light skim and ring with some light ropy lacing. The aroma is mainly lemony cirtus, wheat, cloves and bananas (well blalanced) but if you breathe deep you can notice a faint medicial scent. Very refreshing! Taste is really clean with no overpowering flavours. Quite wheaty overall albiet not strong. I’m losing flavour as this warms...or is it the herbs that are numbing my taste buds? Some vanilla, clove and a touch of banana linger and an obvious tart flavour. Medium light bodied, fairly creamy and highly carbonated. Dry and tart finish and a mouthfeel that does not let you forget the beer too quickly. The tartness is close to a bitter feel but doen’t quite make it there. Way more enjoyable colder as it was better and more intriguing early on. Interesting, mild and refreshing.

Hazy pale yellow with a huge foamy head with great retention and minimal lacing. Aroma is wheat, herbs, banana and cloves. Flavor is sweeter than expected with wheat, banana esters, herbs and spices. Body is a little thin. Very refreshing.

Yellowy beige gold body and was a little more then hazy but not really cloudy in the body so I don’t think you can really call this a true krystal weizen but at least there were no visible chunkies, a good quarter inch cap was produced that lasted pretty much the entire brew and left curtains of lacing behind. Aroma is nice and complex keeping me interested in the beer; soap, banana, wheat, perfume, and tons of lemon make up the nice aroma and it was relatively strong without being overbearing I liked it. Dam it that soapy smell comes through pretty strong in the taste not a fan of this, wheat yeast and lots of lemon make up most of the flavor and it has a good banana finish. You can really taste the herbs they have added to the mix I’m not sure what they are but it tastes a lot like jager. Good tasty and very unique I’m glad I tried it, it’s not overly mind blowing but for a change and to try something a little different this works nicely. Review done while watching Sponge Bob Square Pants.

Bottle. High creamy and lasting white head. Hazy yellow body with a lot of bubbles. Pleasant apple pear banana lemon aroma with nutty undertones. Heavily carbonated strong lemon flavor and banana in the background. Long aftertaste. Quite refreshing.

Tap @ Charlies, Cph.

Pours hazy, pale yellow with a nice, staying, creamy, white head. Sweet wheaty aroma, light citric, banana and soft coriander. Flowery hops. Light carbonation, fine mouthfeel. Pretty sweet flavour, banana, apples and light spiciness. But still, this is immensely drinkable and fresh.
Hazy orange with asmall white head. Sweet fruity aroma with caramel and malty notes. Flavour was malty with caramel and lemon notes. Finished sweet.

33 cL bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Fruity and light spiced aroma. Fruity, yeasty and wheaty flavoured. Distinct fruity and sweet. Light citrusy touch into a mild yeasty finish.6-3-6-3-11=2.9



From tap at Ølbaren. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is light chemical and spiced. Citrusy and spiced flavoured with a distinct banana estery base flavour. Citrusy and fruity finish, light phenolic dryness too. 6-3-7-3-13=3.2

33 cl bottle from the gift shop of the Starobrno brewery in Brno
BB 12-2009
On May 20, 2009
Twist off cap
Cloudy yellow color with yeast sediment, big fluffy white head. Banana estery scent, also clove, some solvents and phenoles. Banana, estery, clove taste. Medium mouthfeel, low bitterness.

Golden to amber with nice white head, aroma is a bit winey with malt sweetness, fruit aroma like peach pineapple and some strawberry, nice acidity as well,  flavor is maltish very sweet with some biscuit, vegy tones and flowers, very lively and unique although bitterness is missing. Medium texture. Good beer

Draft. An unclear light golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma is fresh wheaty and citrusy with a slight touch of chewing gum. The flavor is sweet wheaty with notes of citrus and again some chewing gum, leading to a very dry and very wheaty finish.

Bottle. Creamy white good fully lasting head. Yellow colour.Light malty moderate hoppy very herbal aroma. Yeasty and nice citrus-notes. Moderate bitter flavor. Long very nice moderate bitter finish. Creamy palate. Very nice beer.

Bottle at Universitetsbaren Århus. Hazy yellow golden colour with a very nice and white head. Aroma and taste of citrus, coriander, green apples. Smooth carbonation and very very nice sweet mouthfeel. There´s some Hoegarden Wit taste and appearance. This snowfresh being way better! Thank you Austria!

Bottle at a Leon of Bruxelles. Label had Brau Union Osterreich on the back. Same label as illustration, except Biere Blanche replaced Snowfresh. Hazy golden color with a large, foamy white head. Aromas of citrus/coriander? Medium minus body w/mild carbonation. Like Hoegaarden with fruit and veg. Finishes with light clove. Very drinkable.

Bottled 33cl. Bought in Rietschi Getränke, Arlesheim. Appearance: It pours a murky pale golden beer with a tall, nicely remaining creamy white head. Beautiful lacework. Aroma: Rather strong and inviting. Banana, candy sugar, arabic gum, sherbet and lime. Flavor and palate: Huge amounts of strawberry, green tea and cinnamon showing up. Good balance. Very interesting. Reminiscent of marjoram and bubble gum. Medium bodied. Sweetish. The slallow is dominated by herbs leaving a spicy &#40coriander&#41 finish. Overall impression: Extremely refreshing and pleasant. An excellent Spice/Herb/Vegetable. I’m against the grain here.
33cl bottle. Pours a light golden, fizzy but no head retention. Nice friuty yeast nose, with a very bright tinge. Lovely fruity flavour, subtle but not a killer beer. Would definitely have another.

[1987-20090205] 330mL bottle. Fresh sweet pine yeast -- it really is snowfresh! Slightly hazy, light orange brown body with a medium-lasting creamy white head. Sweet and spicy yeast flavour still has that nice fresh pine yeast. Medium body is a little spicy. Quite refreshing.

(w/ jerc, others)

A hazy blonde weizen with a thick white head. A sweet banana aroma with tangerine and lemon notes. In mouth, a nice light weizen, creamy, with bananas and cloves. Medium bodied. BB 02-09. Bottle bought at LCBO.

330 ml bottle. Aroma has lots of herbs, some cirtus and hops. Herbs gives beer totally special aroma which separates this one from other wits. Yellow / orange coulour with very light head. Tastes like the spice clove. Interesting one.

330 ml bottle. From Estonia (H).
Orange colour with almost no head.
Sweet fruity aroma with wheat, spices and hints of strange sausage aroma. Flavour is sweet with fruits, yeast, coriander and cloves. Interesting beer, more Witbier-like than many other Hefeweizens.

Murky orange-yellow in colour with a thin white head, light lacing.  The aroma is spicy, some bananas, flowers and some citrus.  The flavour is lightly spicy, some cloves, lemon citrus, moderate bitterness.  Moderately bitter mouthfeel, medium body, medium/high carbonation.  Finishes long, citrusy with some spice.


Not bad but is this a wit beer?  Seems to thin out quite a bit at the very end.


330ml bottle from the LCBO in Peterborough, Ontario.

Opened on June 20, 2008.

BB February 2009.
Very misty pale yellow color. Banana flavor with a hint of bubblegum. Dry end.

Pours a very cloudy golden with a fluffy white head. Quite a sweet aroma, with banana and bubblegum coming through strong, with some orange notes and a hint of yeast and herb. Incredibly smooth in body, with the banana and bubblegum flavours dominating each mouthful..An orange and citrus finish. No surprises after the aromas - a fresh and smooth weiss beer.

Bottled@Smak 09.  A dense two-finger white head upon a misty, pale yellow-golden body.  Mildly spiced, artificial banana aroma. Taste is sourish wheaty,  sharp fruity with a metallic twist. Quite thin-bodied. Dry, light acidulous finish.

Sample from 330 ml bottle at the Brewery International stand, Smak 09. ABV is 5.0%. Golden colour, hazy, moderate head. Moderate hefeweizen aroma, notes of cloves and bubblegum. The flavour is fairly dry with moderate notes of cloves.

Bottle, bought in Mlada Boleslav, Bohemia: Pale golden, hazy, stable bleached head; moderate sweetish-fruity (lemons)  and wheaty nose with a distinctive herbal (coriander) touch; light to moderate sweetish-sourish flavour, quite light bodied for a beer of 5.2% ABV; sweetish-grainy finish with a light lemony acidity in the aftertaste. Not unpleasant, a quite well polished Weizen.....

330 ml bottle, served in a glass.

The traditional look of a white beer, with a lasting, white foamy head.  Starts off with a orange-y taste, then moves to a sweet honey flavor, and then finishes off with a hint of coriander. A lovely beer all around, and one your never going to forget!

Draught at Wachi. 
A decently made weiss, and somewhat original, but the herbs really got on my nerves. Too sweet and cloying. Overdone and unenjoyable.
A really nice beer on a lazy day.  Pours hazy blonde, palate is very nice with hints of citrus and hop.  Very enjoyable.

sua aparência, que apresenta espuma de tamanho médio e coloração branca. Nem por sua boa formação de colarinho e reduzida longevidade. Também não está acima da média seu corpo borbulhante e turvo, de tonalidade amarelo-claro. Em seu aroma, a presença de algo diferente. Além dos tradicionais banana e cravo, farejam-se também notas de goma de mascar e um leve aroma de coco, que incitam sobremaneira o paladar. Seu delicioso sabor é moderadamente doce e levemente ácido no início,contando com a presença da goma de mascar farejada na etapa anterior, apresentando leve acidez e amargor no final, este de média duração. No paladar me deparei com um corpo médio-leve, de textura aguada, forte carbonatação e final de sensação levemente metálica. Apresenta também um gosto condimentado

A hazy grubby, yellow colored beer, with a thick white head. The aroma of fruity malt, with citrus and banana, a little hop. The taste is fresh fruity, bananas, flowery. And it has some perfume. The aftertaste is fruitflowers and some bitter.

Uma das melhores cervejas de trigo que já tomei. Coloração âmbar clara, turva, com uma espuma densa volumosa e de média duração, deixando uma boa camada perene. Aroma e sabor bem destacados, com notas cítricas, sobressaindo banana, porém sem exageros. Refrescante. Conjunto harmônico. Perfeita inserção de álcool. O grande trunfo dessa breja, ao meu ver, é que o fabricante conseguiu fazer uma cerveja de trigo muito bem equilibrada, sem ser leve demais, nem cítrica demais. Tudo é bem balanceado. Parabéns!
Pale golden color, creamy head, cloudy texture but light body. Strong spicey  aroma. Very refreshing unique taste with full of coriander, banana, citruses. Great.

Excelente Weissbier! Extremamente refrescante, ótima formação de espuma, além dos tradicionais sabores de banana e cravo, bem como no aroma, essa cerveja tem notas de hervas bem distintas e também notas cítricas. No final traz uma boa sensação refrescante.

Poured hazy blonde appearance with a nice foamy white head. Freaky, interesting aroma of spices, herbs, some honey. Feeling like a trip in the Alps, perfume of the meadows on the hillside. The flavor is similar with some unique taste of herbs (sage?), honey and cinnamon, some flavor of banana and citruses. Absolutely exciting character with unusual tastes. Nice character, fine body, refreshing one
25Kc from Kaufland in Prague.  Not bad white beer.  A little too sweet and fruity.  Tasty and not bad.  Doesn’t beat Hoegaarden but wanted to try a different white beer.

Bouteille 330ml, courtoisie de Blankboy. De couleur jaune-dorée et très légèrement voilée. Nez de levures fruitées (bananes, agrumes), moyen d’épices (clou de girofle, léger de coriandre, notes de cannelle), léger de blé et avec des notes de sucre bonbon, de gomme balloune et de houblon herbeux. Moyen-léger en bouche avec un pétillement moyen et une texture moyennement crémeuse et aux petites notes aqueuses. Goût de levures fruitées aux faibles notes sûres (bananes, agrumes sucrées) acccompagné d’un goût épicé (léger de clou de girofle, notes de coriandre et traces de cannelle) et de notes de gomme balloune lors de l’entrée en bouche auquel se rajoute un moyen goût de blé ainsi que des traces de sucre bonbon puis en finale l’on retrouve une légère amertume de houblon herbeux (herbes humides) et aux notes florales asséchantes. Post-goût moyen, légèrement amer de houblon herbeux aux notes florales, de levures fruitées (pelures de bananes, léger zest de agrumes) et avec un léger goût de blé.
Pours a very cloudy white-ish yellow and the head sticks around for quite a while. Aroma is citrus and very yeasty, but pleasant. Palate is slightly watery, and very citrusy. Very clean weissbier

This one poured a light yellow colour with a nice thick, bright white head. To the nose there are scents of spice, corn, cinnamon and bubblegum. First taste was slightly watery with flavours of bubblegum and hand cream. Finish is smooth and very flavoured iin gum and cream.

bottle, Hypernova Ceské Budejovice. Hazy deep golden colour with an orange glow. Large white head. Aroma of Nivea hand creme. Full-bodied, quite spicy again with the flavour of a certain cosmetic product. Not in a negative sense, though, this is quite nice actually. Sweet and spicy with some herbal flavours and a creamy texture. Extremely unusual, but rather nice.
Spicey corriander aroma. Cloudy light orange colour with creamy white head. Big clove flavour. Very short mouthfeel.

Slight hazy pale yellow hue, with an off-white head, yeasty, bananaish, citrus, herbal root nose, with a hint of spicy ginger root, ripe apple fruitiness in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a yeasty, fruity, spicy, banana character, with a kind of apple juice fruitiness, with some hints of vanilla, ginger root and aromatic herbs, maybe eldelweiss and gentian flowers, leading towards a spicy kind of cinnamon finish.

Bottle.  Poured hazy gold, with a thin head that remained to the bottom of the glass.  Decent lacing.  Slightly skunky aroma, with green apple.  Flavor was spice and citrus fruit, with lingering wheatiness.  An OK beer.

No 518

Rated: 25.08.2008

Bottle brown, 330 ml, 12.3 P

Appearance: Pours cloudy, lemony to honey like in colour, reminding water mixed with honey and lemon juice, carbonation of the body is intensive but mild, very natural like effervescence, hed is snowy white, big, slowly decreasing to small, firm and lasting due to a very good saturation, there is quite nice lacing.

Aroma: Very fresh and lively aroma of coriander, spear mint, hints of white bread skin, unbaked dough, pastry, batter, vanilla, grains, especially whaet and gentle maltyness at the background, lime, peach, clementine, pumpkin, interesting and sophisticated cereal grains, alcohol is well hidden, very mild and pleasant with notes of whipped cream, gentle notes of powder sugar, banana and bubble gum but very natural and positive with unpasteurised accents. Clearly a good witbier.

Flavour: Front is soft and refreshing than comes some upfront sweetness, later on distinct accidity on palate, many interesting aromatic fruits, most of all peach, orange, nice tart, lemon and lime, banana and nice accents of grains especially wheat covering barley at the background, whipped cream, perfume hops, well rounded and balanced taste, white bread skin is very expressive and explicitly pronounced, gentle sweetness and stickyness from sugary - sweet accents balancing the taste, notes of dough, batter, cereal grains, bubble gum, aromatic flowery - hoppy bose.

Palate: Body is medium, texture is quite mild but with good saturation, carbonation on palate is quite lively, finish feel is mineral and very long with lingering aromatic spicy - flowery nose. It’s a good Witbier not as Spice/Herb/Vegetable as such in my opinion.
cloudy bright orange colour with a bad head retention; robust spicy aroma, mints, herbs and coriander; sweet and medium-bodied, a hint of citrusy acidity; long spicy finish - quite fresh and pleasant

Orangy tan pour with a really thick buubly head.  The head had no cling to it though.  Strong citrus scent.  A bit lemoney and spicey.  A really nice taste.  A bit more tart and flavourful then most Wit’s I have had.  Wish I could get this here more often.

mmmmH! the first real weat wannabe out of german that i taste!!!
[eyes] good yellow color, the head is smoth bu creamy
[nouse] gooood sweet, frash and gentile weat aroma.
[mouth] Austria in germany??? good weiss beer, the flacor is great, fresh, medium body...

Gooood weissbier of austria, bravo!

341 ml bottle 



App.: 
Lightly cloudy golden poor, nice white head.



Aromas: 
Coriander, oranges, unripenned bananas, herbal, minty...



Palate:
Light to Medium body, bubbly, nicely balanced weisen.




Flavors: 
Mainly the same as the aromas, citrus




Notes: Delightfull weizen, nothing spectacular, well rounded overall.

was actually nice and refreshing, hazy yellow color, nice white foam, yeasty nose kinda orange , flavor profile follows suite, with the yeasty cirus , kinda thin but would go down like water on a hot summer day

Bottle. Pours hazy yellow and has a white head. Aroma has citrus, hops, candy, sweetnes and yeast. Flavor is quite thin and watery. Has citrus, hops and marmalade. There is some strange touch to this brew that I can´t put the finger on...

330 ml bottle from LCBO, served cold in a tulip glass.



App.:  Cloudy golden, small white foam.
  
Aroma:  A really nice, inviting floral, perfumed sweetness, hard to say what the herbs are, but maybe lavender?, sort of fruity (white grapes and tropical fruits), a bit of yeast, apricot and light berries, a touch of mandarin orange.
  
Palate:  Medium body and fairly full effervescence with some sharp bubbles.
  
Flav.:  Plenty of the perfumed, floral notes, lots of nice apricot and berry fruits, light yeast, slightly grassy, some wheat, a bit of honey; dry with no bitterness and lingering flower petals with some sweet orange notes.



A nice treat.  Unique and enjoyable.
Really enjoyed this.  Nice, fine, head.  Very sweet flavour and aroma.  The best of three I tried tonight.
