Pours a cloudy yellow with a small foamy white head. Aroma of herbs, fruit, yeast, clove, and wheat. Flavour similar with a hint of mint, and quite spicy. The aftertaste was sweet. It went down smooth but was intense at the same time.
An herbal, almost minty aroma.  Spicy but ultimately kind of weak and an aftertaste that lingered for far too long.
Cloudy yellow with small white head.  Fruity aroma.  Pretty casual weizen beer.  Could taste banana, citrus.

0,33 l bottle. Dark yellow color, medium big head. Very refreshing and interesting beer, mainly because it’s characteristic  spicy flavors. Otherwise it tastes like an usual Weizen : fruity, yeasty, malty. Leaves an exceptionally pleasant sweet aftertaste. Nice...

Brown bottle, 330 ml, best before 02-2009, purchased at the LCBO on July 11 2008, savoured on July 21 2008; eye: golden with a withish hue, lightly hazy, average effervescence, champagne-style white head that turns into a ring, no lacing; nose: wheat, yeast, banana, light spices, light peach, light orange, light floral, light perfume; mouth: yeast, wheat, banana, light peach, light orange, light spices, finale in fresh bread with a good presence of orange, lightly sweet, thin-medium body, foamy texture, rather carbonated; overall: quite likable

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille brune, 330 ml, meilleure avant 02-2009, achetée à la LCBO le 11 juillet 2008, savourée le 21 juillet 2008; œil : dorée avec une teinte blanchâtre, légèrement voilée, effervescence moyenne, mousse blanche style champagne qui tombe pour se transformer en un petit anneau, pas de dentelle; nez : blé, levure, banane, léger épices, léger pêche, orange, léger floral, léger parfum; bouche : levure, blé, banane, léger pêche, léger orange, léger épices, finale en pain frais avec une bonne présence d’orange, légèrement sucrée, corps mince-moyen, texture mousseuse, plutôt carbonatée; en résumé : bien aimé

Bouteille de 330 ml, acheté le 14/7/08 au LCBO de Summerhill (Toronto). Jaune blachie pale, petit collet. Arome très parfumé d’herbe doux, blé savonneux. Goût de de blé légé avec une touche d’agrume, un peu de mente qui reste dans la bouche. Tres intéressant!

bottle. interesting aroma, some mint or other herb. smooth feel, wheat and slight fruit taste. light body makes it an easy drink. overall not too impressed however, this could have been more present in taste, aroma and feel.
Bottle in Split, Croatia. Yellow - white head. Candy, herbal toothpaste, soapy, wheat, citric, warm and high carbonated.

Definitely not the usual. Very pale straw, quickly fizzing out head, candied citrus peel aroma with notes of mint. Body is incredibly soft, with mild carbonation  -- this ain’t packing snow. Banana and pink bubblegum in the finish, although the middle flavours are more wheaty and dry. There is something distinctly Alpine about it, and krauterliquors come to mind somewhere in there. Worth a try, but not sure I’d drink it again.

Thanks to ghawener.  Drank it during Eurocup final 2008.  Sorry ghawener.  A nice brew, I thought it was a Hefeweizen, but guess not.  Don´t really know what is a spice/herb/vegetable.  Any way, I really enjoyed it, it was spicy with some lemon undertones.
bottle: heffe bready with mint undertone. well balanced and complex. good session beer. euro 08 final.

Aroma is wheat, spice and a hint of banana, hazy yellow, small firm white head, lots of carbonation. Tastes of wheat, a trace of banana, spice is subtle. Light bodied, balanced, very easy drinking, refreshing. Great little beer, very cool bottle.

Bottle 0.33 l. Yellow haziness, ultrapersistent creamy head. Honey, candy, perfume, yeast nose. Candy, honey, wheat, melon, some unidentified herbs maybe. Tasty, in-your-face, candyish American style weizen.

0.33l bottle, 5.0% a/v

Pours a light murky colour with an average looking white head. Smells nice and spicy, bananas and peach, very appetizing smell.  The taste is not very sweet at the beginning, but quickly mellows into an excellent spice, herb, fruit sweetness, lots of bananas. Very good mouthfeel, and overall a great and refreshing wheat.

330 ml bottle - pours dull, slightly cloudy straw blond, lacks the "brightness" of a god hefe.  Thick, sticky white head settles down after a bit.  Strong fruity aroma, almost candy-like, with some medicinal notes as well, I guess from the herbs.  Lemon and mint, too.  Maybe a hint of nutmeg?  Compelling.  Very fresh smelling.  Flavour similar to a hefe, but with a few more crisp, dry herbal notes.  Wonderfully refreshing - perfect hot weather beer.

hazy yellow pour, with little to no head. Lots of yeast in the aroma along with lots of citrus, especially lemon. Flavour is very much all lemon to my tastes, its like a lemon lifesaver. Its interesting, not 100% unpleasant, but i’m not tasting any "alpine herbs".

Warm from the bottle, I was thirsty! Like a fruity krystal weizen with a few twists. The spiciness of the added herbs really compliments the clvoe phenolics typical of hefe fbeers. Very well made and good tasting, and WAY better than some Belgian fruity crap. which seems to be the shits.
Light hazy yellow with large white head. Aroma is lightly spiced with fruity fresh lightly banana aroma. Bit of spiced up banana and bubble gum. Clean fresh palate with light acidity.

Pours a hazy yellow with a thin white head. Aroma is spicey, fruity and herbal. The flavour is light, with some banana being the most prominent flavour, a little coriander, and a bit of herbal alpin bitter finish. A damn refreshing beer, with great drinkability. Cheers!

Cloudy blond color, no head; it has anyway a persistent perlage. Aroma of banana candies and chewing-gum. It has a sweetish flavor, with very light wheat, some banana, no spices, almost no bitterness. If you hate beer, you like this.
Pours deep yellow with white foaming head.  Fresh and refreshing unique spiciness, this leaves your breath fresh and minty, ready to yodel.  Herbal and wintermint in aroma, drinks very smooth.
Strong white head, milky golden colour with a strong aroma. Tastes clean, finishes with a strong, bitter aftertaste, I’d drink it again.

Bottle-Cloudy yellow pour with a frothy but short lived white cap, leaving a little lace.
The aromas are banana and clove with lemon and malts with a minty, herbal essence that s quite interesting. That must be the alpine herbs. Tastes of lemon and other citrus fruit, sweet banana, cloves and again an interesting minty spiciness. I quite like it. The finish is creamy and lingering.

Twist top bottle???

Pours a decent looking clouded pale straw in the glass with a 3 finger puffy cap. Great lacing. Color and look more reminiscent of a Belgian wit  

Good aroma for a commercial weissbier; banana, spices, cloves, bit of fruit bubblegum, and a mild herbal under tone....nice!

A whack of sweet malts up front that instantly is joined with fruits, spice and some fine bittering herbs that compliment  and brighten the hops...finish dries out nicely with a crisp snap and a bit of puckering dryness.

Really nicely carried off  for a commercial effort.Aromatic. fruity lightly sweet with a dry crispness. Very decent flavourful summer drink.

Clear bottle 330 ml 
 
Appearance: Cloudy wheat ale with medium light ,semi dense head . 3-
Nose  Herbal , citric aroma, grassy with light wheat bready hints.
 Flavor/Palate : Character fully displayed. Ripe banana, citric side with herbal , wild root like finish. Caramel anise with mineral streak. Reminds me more of Belgian wit than classic weizen.

pours like typical wheat beer, cloudy pale yellow with big white frothy head.  Aroma is what gives it character.  Flavor is rather typical of this beer style, perhaps even milder in flavor than others I have tried.  Overall not as interesting as I expected.  A  good beer nonetheless., I would buy again (price is decent) just not something I would seek out to try again.  Does go down nice on a warm summer day.

330ml bottle from the LCBO. Pours the ideal Hefe look, but a smaller head. Odd smelling, but in a nice way, herbal of course, with lots of yeast. Flavour isn’t as different as I was expecting, but it’s still a bit odd. A hint of mint along the typical hefe flavours, but what really stands out is this bubble-gum flavour. Pleasant and drinkable, but only mildly out of the ordinary. The only thing I don’t personally like very much is the sourness in the finish. Cool bottle though.

330 ml bottle from the LCBO. pours hazy yellow white an everlasting pure white head. aromas of belgian wit and bubble gum. flavours are very similar to the aromas. the alpine herbs add an interesting twist. reminds me so much of bubble gum. enjoyable but i couldnt have to in a row. nice beer if you were on a date and planned to make out after. i will buy this one again.

330 mL bottle.  (bb 02/2009).  Cloudy yellow beer that seems to have an almost greenish tinge to it.  Very active with a nice white head to it.  Typical weiss aroma with something very fresh and herbal/floral underneath.  There is something a little different about the taste as well, but I can’t quite put my finger (tongue?) on it - unfamiliar "alpine herbs" I suppose.  It’s a little sweet (honey?), with mild mint, bananas, semi-sweet citrus, bubble gum, and wheat.  Medium body, medium to high carbonation.  Not bad - it certainly differentiates itself a bit from some of the other wheat beers out there.

330ml bottle 

5.0% ABV 

I tried this beer on June 5, 2008 at "Smokeless Joe’s" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  The beer poured a hazy golden orange colour with a thick white head which lasted a few minutes.  The aroma was wheat, some cloves, and a little bit of hops.  The mouthfeel was medium-bodied and highly carbonated.  The flavour was sweet wheat with some clove, banana, and coriander.
schiuma media piuttosto persistente sentori fruttati acerbi mela verde non speziata erbacea rinfrescante acidita non elavata non molto persistente

The bottle says "aromatic taste of alpine herbs" This is true. You can definartely taste a hint of pine and fresh air. The beer is very easy drinking and has no aftertaste. Appearance is great. Yellow white coulour. Not typical for a true weissbeer.

Found Edelweiss in a Prague supermarket. Very pleased with my purchase. Fine, foamy head. Diaphonous, golden color is slightly more transparent than the typical weissbier. This Edelweiss is not your typical weissbier. It is hard for me to put my finger on exactly what separates Edelweiss, except for the color. As others have said, it has a spice flavor and aroma. Lovely, smooth finish. It’s very refreshing.

330ml Bottle- Amber/orange in colour with a small head. The aroma is spicy with bananas featuring prominently. The taste is quite mellow at first but the spices are detectable again with the banana being very noticeable and lingering in the finish.
got this beer from the hypernova supermarket in the Czech republic. It is good drinkeble, but it is not the hefeweizen I used to drink/like.....

(Bottle) Purchased at Spinnakers Wine Merchant for $2.65. Pours a cloudy orange-amber body with a thin, creamy white head. Banana nose with hints of mild bubblegum. Somewhat sweet flavour with a decent spiced finish. Above average.
Bottle bought in Riga. Nice fresh wheaty herby bit banana aroma. Good wheaty, coriander dry flavour with herbs and fruits. Dru wheat fruity long lasting finish.

Bottled (BB 09/2008)

Hazy orange color, decent creamy white head. Wheat, clove, sugar and coriander in the nose. Clove, banana and wheat in the herbal flavor. More or less ordinary witbier with some interesting herbs/spices added.
great beer. very easy to drink, excelente for summer days. Sweet citrus and corriander aroma, some banana too

bottled. hazy orange with plenty of gunk clinging to the bottom of the bottle. heady aroma of deodorant and lemon barley lollies. pretty drinkable, some faint lemon rind tartness, the only hefeweizen that’s readily available in plzen supermarkets and it could be worse

330ml bottle.
Light hazy orange, quickly dissipating head. Sweet citrus and corriander aroma, some banana too. However, it’s a bit lemonady. Taste is fairly typical yeasty wheat beer taste - with a bit more zing and citrus, and slightly thin and with sharp carbonation - more lemonady. Probably pretty OK as a summer time quencher, but when you’re thirsty everything tastes better.
An orange beer with a very creamy white head. Aroma is lots of herbs and yeasty. The body is a little bit thin. Taste is wheaty, fruity (banana), notes of herbs. A good wheat beer

Bottle: head that disappears fast, thin and watery mouthfill but still a pretty nice beer, wheaty, yeasty, pretty sweet, fruity, banana, sweet oranges and mandarines, some herbal notes, quite refreshing, nice wheat beer.

330ml bottle.

Pours a semi-hazy olive yellow with a small white head. Aroma is fruity and floral. Raisins, prunes, and wheat with lots of spices. Taste is similar with some doughy bread notes along the line of a belgian style ale. Has a bit of an herbal twist to it also. Smooth oily feel with a little bit of a sticky finish. Had this one a long time ago and hated it but I suppose now I’m more used to the style and think this a pretty nice beer. Give it a try.

Comments: A strange, yet not unpleasant wheat beer with strong spicey flavours: cinnamon? Cardamom? But overall, a bit too sweet for me to be overly enthusiastic since it fails to be refreshing enough with that sweetness.

Bottled at Bierfestival Gusswerk: Intensive bubble gum aroma. Yellow color. Flavor is sweet, herbal and flowerly notes and again a quite intensive bubble gum note. Dry, light grainy finish. I don’t like this bubble gum notes....

Bottle (330ml).  via trade with mgermani.  Cloudy orangeish yellow, smallish fizzy white diminishing head.  Bananas, yeast, spice and floral hops in the aroma.  Taste has less fruit, more spice and a lot of candy sweetness, sweet herbal bitter finish.  Watery, sharply carbonated body - very crisp, solid, but not sock-knocking-off.

Hazy golden color. Massively spicy nose of ginseng, cinammon, cough medicine and herbs. Very awesome. Light bodied. Huge ginseng, candy cane and cinammon mouth Refreshing ginseng finish. Really surprised by this one.

Vary pale and hazy dull yellow colour.  Minimal head.  Aroma is citrus and herbal. Lots of cloying sweetness with herbal notes.  Nice yeast and banana flavour.  Its like a wit with an extra spice or two.

@ GJBF 2007.  Strong spice and wheat aroma with some fruit and yeast as well.  Spicy flavor with nice earth tones, sweet fruit, wheat, floral, some banana, yeast and lightly bitter.  Was an excellent suprise at the festival.

0.33 l bottle. Pours pale yellow murky body with relatively big white head. Strong aroma of banana with herbs...flavor is also quite nice, bitter but balanced with sweetness of fruits and alpine herbs. Not bad beer, but nothing special either + too fruity for my taste.

0.33L bottle. strong aromas of wheat and yeast, small head, hazy golden colour with a lot of carbonation. flavours of flowers and forest, certainly some pine and maple, pleasant and refreshing sourness at the end.
This beer seems to me much more a belgian wittbier than a weizen.
A big suprise and an excellent beer.

Wow! Pleasently surprised with this one. A flowery smelling beer that pours a slighty cloundy golden color annd short head. Distinct floral and herb palate without the soapiness. A nice smooth finish that suprisingly left no bitter aftertaste. Definitely worth the 3.50/bottle I paid for it.

Lemon, lime, lychee and banana fruitiness combine with a floral character and soft doughy wheat in the sweet aroma.  Hazy golden body is topped by a decent white head that recedes slowly to cover.  Flavour is extremely herbal and floral with strong banana, lemon and wheat to support it.  Light body with very crisp, strong carbonation.  Cold, I found this a bit quiet in its expression but allowed to warm a little the flavours shine.  Stem glass.  Cellar temperature.  Bottle (Brewery Creek, Jul-07).

Bottle shared with GregClow, Jerc, and Blankboy, Greg’s bottle.  Hazy yellow, small white head.  Nice aroma - lots of lemon and yeast.  Great taste - refreshing lemon, lots of yeast and zest.  Soft, floral, well carbonated.  Simple but very well done and very enjoyable.
